blogs.title: Glass spheres, an art that embellishes Christmas in Mexico.
blogs.shortDescription: Esferas, arte en vidrio que engalana la Navidad en México. La Navidad en México es una arraigada tradición única en el mundo, que año con año se ve engalanada con las esferas que elaboran las manos mágicas de maestros artesanos

description.text: Christmas in Mexico is a deep-rooted tradition unique in the world, bedecked year after year with spheres made by the magical hands of master craftsmen who use the blown glass technique, shaping these garnishes that exalt this festivity.

The two most representative and destinations for these iconic items are the Magical Towns of Tlalpujahua, Michoacán and Chignahuapan, Puebla. Here, year after year, thousands of national and foreign visitors flock in search of these ornaments while at the same time enjoying the tourist attractions and the gastronomy of these places.

The spheres that embellish the Christmas season in Mexico are the product of a tradition inherited from one generation to the next since the 17th century when it arrived in our country; however, there are records dating back more than 2000 years that document these spheres were manufactured in China.
The technique was spread to Europe and later Mexican communities adopted it and handed it down since the time of the viceroyalty, resulting in an extraordinary fusion that remains to this day.

blogs.title: TLALPUJAHUA AND THE SPHERE FAIR
blogs.shortDescription: The importance of the tradition and production of these artisan creations is such that the Sphere Fair is one of the five most important festivities in Tlalpujahua. Taking place from October to December, its aim is to show yearly visitors a wide variety of colors, models and sizes of spheres produced in the community. In this way, homes will have one of the most characteristic elements of Christmas in Mexico.

description.text: The importance of the tradition and production of these artisan creations is such that the Sphere Fair is one of the five most important festivities in Tlalpujahua. Taking place from October to December, its aim is to show yearly visitors a wide variety of colors, models and sizes of spheres produced in the community.
In this way, homes will have one of the most characteristic elements of Christmas in Mexico.

Tlalpujahua is approximately a three hours drive from Mexico City, and around two hours from Morelia or Toluca. It is located in the northwest of the state of Michoacán, bordering with the municipalities of Maravatío, Contepec, Senguio, and the State of Mexico.

It is the birthplace of the Mexican insurgent Ignacio López Rayón, which is why the official name of the destination is Tlalpujahua de Rayón, and it stands out for its architecture with buildings dating back to the viceregal era and grand houses with balconies. It also boasts a rich mining history.

So, should you have the chance to visit this Magical Town to get Christmas spheres, allow yourself the opportunity to also visit unmissable places such as the Hermanos Rayón House-Museum, the Sanctuary of Nuestra Señora del Carmen, or the Dos Estrellas Mine.

Tlalpujahua is also surrounded by awe-inspiring natural sites, which gives it a special charm. Proof of this is the Monarch Butterfly Sanctuary, which between the months of November and February hosts thousands of specimens of this migratory species, who travel all the way from Canada to the forests of Michoacán.
Due to its beauty, Tlalpujahua was granted the status of Magical Town on June 27, 2005.

blogs.title: CHIGNAHUAPAN AND ITS SPHERE SHOPS
blogs.shortDescription: In  this Magical Town in the state of Puebla, there are more than 200 workshops and sphere factories recorded, where annually tens of millions of pieces of art that embellish Christmas in Mexico are produced.

description.text: In  this Magical Town in the state of Puebla, there are more than 200 workshops and sphere factories recorded, where annually tens of millions of pieces of art that embellish Christmas in Mexico are produced.

Located two and a half hours from Mexico City, ninety minutes from Pachuca and a little over two hours from the city of Puebla, Chignahuapan is a beautiful town nestled between hills, which  provides its peculiar climate, particularly chilly.

The Mudejar kiosk is one of the spots that every tourist should visit due to its colorful style, characteristic  of the Mudejar artistic current that emerged in Spain at the end of the 19th century. It is also the mandatory photo backdrop for everyone who visits.

There are also the Basilica of the Immaculate Conception and the Plaza de Armas, but the natural attractions are the most representative in this Magical Town. Waterfalls such as El Cajón, Quetzalapan, its lagoons and hot springs, are just some of the points most sought after by visitors.
Now you know: Tlalpujahua and Chignahuapan are the two most recommended options not only to buy your spheres for the next Christmas season, but also to discover two amazing Magical Towns of Mexico.

blogs.title: 10 ACTIVITIES YOU CAN DO IN COZUMEL
blogs.shortDescription: In the Mexican Caribbean lies Cozumel, one of Mexico's most prized island paradises. Its abundance of natural resources merges perfectly with both the Mayan Culture legacy and modern infrastructure —such as its international airport, its hotel area and a dock suitable for large cruise ships— to receive tourism.

description.text: In the Mexican Caribbean lies Cozumel, one of Mexico's most prized island paradises. Its abundance of natural resources merges perfectly with both the Mayan Culture legacy and modern infrastructure —such as its international airport, its hotel area and a dock suitable for large cruise ships— to receive tourism.
Cozumel, Quintana Roo, also known as the Island of the Swallows, is an ideal place for marine flora and fauna observation, since it is located on the second-largest barrier reef in the world.

Surrounded by the turquoise waters of the Caribbean Sea, more than half its territory is a Protected Natural Area intended for conservation and the practice of responsible tourism to please visitors who arrive either by boat or by air.

It is a very common option to take a ferry from Playa del Carmen to visit Cozumel. However, this island has a wide range of activities, so it is well worth a stay of a few days to enjoy it to the fullest.

blogs.title: MUST-DO ACTIVITIES IN COZUMEL
blogs.shortDescription: Since the pier is one of the main entrance sites to this insular destination, it is recommended to visit it, as well as downtown San Miguel de Cozumel. The municipal capital, and part of the historical and cultural sites are located here, as well as restaurants, handicraft and souvenir stores, among other establishments. In addition, you can admire the modern murals that give it a very picturesque and pleasant touch, and which are ideal for taking some nice pictures.

list.title: VISIT THE PIER AND THE CENTER OF SAN MIGUEL DE COZUMEL

description.text: Since the pier is one of the main entrance sites to this insular destination, it is recommended to visit it, as well as downtown San Miguel de Cozumel. The municipal capital, and part of the historical and cultural sites are located here, as well as restaurants, handicraft and souvenir stores, among other establishments. In addition, you can admire the modern murals that give it a very picturesque and pleasant touch, and which are ideal for taking some nice pictures.

Thanks to its privileged geographic location, scuba diving is the best way to enjoy the natural wonders of Cozumel. Whether you are an expert or beginner, there are service providers in different areas of the island that will help you. Although, if you prefer snorkeling, it is also possible to just snorkel and see the natural treasures hidden in the depths of this area of the Caribbean Sea.

As its name suggests, at the 'lower' end of Cozumel is Punta Sur. It is a large natural area with wide expanses of vegetation, mangroves and reefs, as well as an impressive lighthouse and the Navigation Museum. This museum preserves the history of the navigators of this area of the Mexican Caribbean, as well as Mayan history, and even vestiges of this impressive culture.

list.title: VISIT THE ARCHAEOLOGICAL SITE OF SAN GERVASIO

description.text: This archaeological site in Cozumel is dedicated to Ixchel, the Mayans goddess of fertility, childbirth, medicine, and the arts. Although this area holds the main vestiges of veneration, throughout Cozumel, there are different manifestations of worship to this deity. It is known that in the past, all women had to visit the island at some point.

list.title: APPRECIATING THE ARRIVAL OF THE SACRED MAYAN JOURNEY

description.text: Regarding Ixchel, it is also important to talk about one of the most significant events of Cozumel, the Sacred Mayan Journey. Nowadays, it is a recreation of the journey made by canoeists starting from the mainland in Playa del Carmen in order to pay tribute to this goddess. The journey is intended as a request for fertility of the land and to show her gratitude for the blessings received.

History, nature, and fun in one place. The Chankanaab Park, already declared a national park, is a place where you can do activities such as snorkeling, diving, and even swimming with dolphins, or just relax at the beach club. It also features a museum, making it one of the best places for all types of travelers.

If Cozumel is the perfect destination for those seeking tranquility and relaxation, El Cedral is the perfect spot on the island. This small town has a particular charm, and has witnessed the passage of history from the rise of the Mayan culture to the present day. It is also home to the second most important festival of the destination: La Fiesta del Cedral, the day of the Holy Cross.

Diving and snorkeling are some of the most popular activities in Cozumel, so there is a wider range of options to enjoy its beaches. Along the coast, you will find experts in paddleboarding, jet skiing or kayaking who will help you enjoy these activities with confidence.

North of Cozumel, there is a small place called Isla Pasión. It is one kilometer long, but it has mangroves, reefs, and a jungle, and you can visit it to enjoy its quiet and relaxing beach or practice activities that offer a little more adrenaline. In addition, due to its characteristics, it has also become a beautiful destination for weddings.

South of Cozumel, at the bottom of the sea with the white sand characteristic of the Caribbean Sea, you can find the authentic marine sky, a placed called El Cielo (“the Sky”). Its name comes from the hundreds of starfish that rest on a wide extension, making this place look like a starry sky, but under the sea. This place is best enjoyed through scuba diving or snorkeling, and it is definitely a must-do when traveling to Cozumel.
